intro: Tetramerium platystegium, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed tetramerium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along streambanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
